jonkeane commented on pull request #11163:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11163#issuecomment-920321789


   I took a look at a few of the errors, and they mostly seem to be in installing dependencies. I wonder if we should add in `GITHUB_PAT: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}` (as recommended by r-lib/actions: https://github.com/r-lib/actions/blob/60e594624f0d630cdbf6bc9deee7b0771f77e0f3/.github/workflows/check-release.yaml#L15) to the GHA jobs at least to reduce those from happening. This is scope creep from this specific change, of course.


--

thisisnic commented on pull request #11163:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11163#issuecomment-922993440


   @jonkeane I wanted to add the relevant PAT to the task described in `dev/tasks/r/github.macos.autobrew.yml ` (it was failing at installed dev rcmdcheck without it), but (see the last but one PR), I did it wrong.  Given that the params that are passed in at the top level get printed out, I was a bit hesitant to try again and risk printing out the PAT.  Any idea how I could go about it without messing things up? 


--

jonkeane commented on pull request #11163:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11163#issuecomment-923179999


   We should confirm this with @kszucs to make sure, but in my understanding they will be masked (and they are limited to the lifetime of the job anyway, though I only learned that by reading https://docs.github.com/en/actions/reference/authentication-in-a-workflow again just now!).
   
   We already have at least one example of [using something like this](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/python-wheels/github.osx.arm64.yml#L155) which [obfuscates it appropriately](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/3648587031#step:11:31).
   
   We could consider removing `printenv` (notably in [`ci/scripts/r_test.sh`](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/556c14c7a520163aa6dbfe351ba22207c7ce74a9/ci/scripts/r_test.sh#L27) ) but also [in two more places as well](https://github.com/apache/arrow/search?q=printenv) to be extra extra careful. (Maybe replace that with a macro that lists a few of the vars we end up caring about like `ARROW_R_DEV`?


--

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Multiple builds have failed due to an error in rcmdcheck which is fixed here: https://github.com/r-lib/rcmdcheck/issues/139

Builds which have failed
https://dev.azure.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=11503&view=logs&j=0da5d1d9-276d-5173-c4c4-9d4d4ed14fdb&t=d9b15392-e4ce-5e4c-0c8c-b69645229181

https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/3555797624?check_suite_focus=true

We should use the dev version of rcmdcheck instead of the CRAN version to prevent this from happening again.
fields.summary: [R] CI jobs should use the latest version of rcmdcheck

comments.body: Closing this ticket as the change is now in the released version of rcmdcheck
